description:
i tried to start an image as below:
openstack server create --flavor m1.tiny --image cirros \
>   --nic net-id=6707368b-8077-4cc1-9d90-c1a41db0ba12 --security-group default \
>   --key-name mykey provider-instance

but i received message:
Unexpected API Error. Please report this at http://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/ and attach the Nova API log if possible.
<class 'oslo_config.cfg.NoSuchOptError'> (HTTP 500) (Request-ID: req-0fbffd23-44a0-47d5-84e1-49901328bec3)

INFO:
nodo1@nodo1:~$ dpkg -l | grep nova
ii  nova-api                             2:13.0.0-0ubuntu5~cloud0              all          OpenStack Compute - API frontend
ii  nova-common                          2:13.0.0-0ubuntu5~cloud0              all          OpenStack Compute - common files
rc  nova-compute-kvm                     2:13.0.0-0ubuntu5~cloud0              all          OpenStack Compute - compute node (KVM)
ii  nova-conductor                       2:13.0.0-0ubuntu5~cloud0              all          OpenStack Compute - conductor service
ii  nova-consoleauth                     2:13.0.0-0ubuntu5~cloud0              all          OpenStack Compute - Console Authenticator
ii  nova-novncproxy                      2:13.0.0-0ubuntu5~cloud0              all          OpenStack Compute - NoVNC proxy
ii  nova-scheduler                       2:13.0.0-0ubuntu5~cloud0              all          OpenStack Compute - virtual machine scheduler
ii  python-nova                          2:13.0.0-0ubuntu5~cloud0              all          OpenStack Compute Python libraries
ii  python-novaclient                    2:3.3.1-2~cloud0                      all          client library for OpenStack Compute API - Python 2.7

vmware workstation 11
title: Unexpected API Error.

comments.content:
i tried to start an image as below:
openstack server create --flavor m1.tiny --image cirros \
>   --nic net-id=6707368b-8077-4cc1-9d90-c1a41db0ba12 --security-group default \

but i received message:
Unexpected API Error. Please report this at http://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/ and attach the Nova API log if possible.

vmware workstation 11
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~adolfo.compagnone

comments.content:
This looks like the system is trying to run the EC2 API that has been removed from upstream, so a badly configured paste.ini file (please see release notes for details).

It also looks like the code may have been incorrectly patched to reference removed configuration values. Unsure if thats an upstream or downstream backport.

Can you reproduce this error with stable/mitaka and devstack, or with master? If not, I would talk to Ubuntu about the issues you are hitting.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~johngarbutt

comments.content: based on another bug report, this package is also having issues with "openstack security group rule list"
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~johngarbutt

comments.content:
Hi, John,

i'll try to analyze the config files.

I can't reproduce this behaviour on other  enviroment (as you suggest
) in this moment.

thank you
Adolfo

comments.content:
There's also a good change that this is a duplicate to bug 1571839
The error "NoSuchOptError: no such option in group neutron: auth_plugin" in your attached api.log makes me think that way.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mzoeller

comments.content:
ok, my installation i affected from some bug still open.

Furthemore, i have searched into my config files and i didn't find specific statement about ec2. I have attached my  paste.ini  file
